instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 3023 - Don't turn ON
threads.message:
Hey, 

this board came with a little liquid around <CHIP>U3810</CHIP>, <RESISTOR>R1900</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C1761</CAPACITOR>. i already clean the areas! 

When i plug the charger the board don't start and <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> warm's up like if the board turning on, and with my lips i feel a little warm's up on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area! 

PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG AND <SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL> comes up when i plug the charger. ideas?? another CPU failure??

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 3023 - Don't turn ON
threads.message: CPU Vcore present???? water damage on J5100, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, any missing voltage????

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 3023 - Don't turn ON
threads.message: Some rail is missing, check them all.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 3023 - Don't turn ON
threads.message: You are right Duke!!! i double check in the place where have the components are corroded and under the processor i have to fix a rail that went to capacitor!! and the machine work's!!! ty all
